results.title: Moonlighting
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Skolimowski, Mark Shivas, Michael White and Centar Film
results.brief_description: Three Polish builders and their foreman, Nowak, (Jeremy Irons), the only one to speak English, enter Britain illegally to renovate the home of a rich fellow Pole. All goes according to plan, but it is December 1981, time of the military crackdown in Poland and Nowak, the only one to find out, decides not to tell the others. Things start to go badly wrong, the workers are restless, money begins to run out, and Nowak resorts to increasingly desperate measures to keep everything under control. A Cannes Film Festival award winner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerzy Skolimowski, Mark Shivas, Michael White and Centar Film

results.title: Moonbird
results.brief_description: A colour cartoon of the fantasy of childhood. Two small boys, armed with rope, cage and bait, embark upon a night-time expedition to capture the nocturnal bird. A bird does finally appear. Making friends, the boys persuade the bird to go home with them. (Award: Venice)

results.title: Monsieur Pointu
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin, ONF | NFB, Bernard Longpre and Andre Leduc
results.brief_description: Here is screen magic at its best. Virtuoso stage entertainer Monsieur Pointu (his real name is Paul Cormier, renowned beyond his native Quebec), becomes even more animated through the art of film animation. He and his violin are literally taken apart - head, feet, limbs, various items of stage attire, bow, strings, and box go into their own separate acts, with strange and amusing results. Film without words. (Four awards, including Oscar nomination, Hollywood)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rene Jodoin, ONF | NFB, Bernard Longpre and Andre Leduc

results.title: Mogambo
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Sam Zimbalist and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Clark Gable reprises his role as the hunter to become the hunted in this lusty remake of the 1932 classic, “Red dust”. Gable is a game hunter in Kenya who becomes involved in an explosive love triangle involving the respectable (yet also emotionally volatile) wife of a British anthropologist (played by Grace Kelly), and a rather forward Broadway show girl, Eloise “Honey Bear” Kelly (Ava Gardner). Marswell (Gable) hooks up early with Honey Bear who he meets while she’s waiting for an African steamer. She misses meeting up with a maharajah, and decides to stay with the rugged hunter instead. Enter anthropologist Donald Nordley (Donald Sinden) and his wife Linda (Grace Kelly), who harbours a secret desire for Marswell who is also instantly taken by her - much to the disappointment of Honey Bear. Nordley has enlisted the help of the professional safari guide to take them on a gorilla documenting hunt. Women are not the only things causing Marswell trouble however, as the native African wildlife and a potential native uprising throw more perils into the mix. Based upon a play by Wilson Collison.

results.title: Missiles of October
results.creator_credit: Robert Berger, Herbert Brodkin, Viacom Enterprises and Anthony Page
results.brief_description: A dramatic re-enactment of the twelve nerve-shattering days in October 1962, following the US discovery of Soviet missile bases in Cuba. The inner workings of government are revealed, as President John F. Kennedy and Nikita Khrushchev grapple with crisis diplomacy. Cast includes Ralph Bellamy, Howard da Silva, John Dehner, William Devane, Andrew Duggan, Dana Elcar, Larry Gates, James Olson, Nehemiah Persoff, William Prince, John Randolph and Martin Sheen.

results.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
results.creator_credit: Curtis Bernhardt, Jerry Wald and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adaptation of W. Somerset Maugham’s “Rain”, a steamy story of sex, sin and salvation in the tropics. Set in the 1940s, it is the story of a bawdy nightclub entertainer, Sadie (Rita Hayworth) and Alfred Davidson (Jose Ferrer), a puritanical preacher waging an anti-sin campaign in the Pacific Islands. When Sadie falls in love with a straight-arrow marine (Aldo Ray), she seeks Davidson’s help in reforming her life. Tragically, the repressed cleric reacts with disbelief and, ultimately violence.

results.title: Miss Congeniality
results.creator_credit: Donald Petrie, Marc Lawrence, Sandra Bullock, Fortis Film and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: FBI special agent Gracie Hart is a man’s woman - she chews with her mouth open, snorts when she laughs, has one eyebrow and is having a “bad hair decade”…So when the FBI needs to send an undercover agent into the famed Miss United States Pageant, Agent Hart certainly isn’t their first choice, she’s their only choice. Cast includes: Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, William Shatner, Candice Bergen, Benjamin Bratt.

results.title: Mina Tannenbaum
results.creator_credit: Martine Dugowson, Georges Benayoun, Les Films de L'Etang, FCC, La Sept Cinema, Christian Bourgois Productions, LA SFFC and Ima Films
results.brief_description: This debut from director Martine Dugowson is a poignant study of friendship as it stands the test of time. Two French Jewish girls - Ethel and Mina, are begrudgingly thrown together by their mutual lack of ascribing to social conventions in Paris in the late 1960’s. As they move into adolescence their friendship blossoms, becomes the only source of happiness, and sometimes a source of conflict as they move away from their peer groups and family. The film chronicles 25 years of the lives and loves of two best friends who share a love/hate relationship. Cast includes Romane Bohringer, Elsa Zylberstein, Florence Thomassin and Nils Tavernier. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Mikey and Nicky
results.creator_credit: Elaine May, Bud Austin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Screen legends John Cassavetes and Peter Falk are Mikey and Nicky, friends since childhood. Their friendship is forcefully renewed when small-time hood Nicky (Cassavetes), seeks out his friend Mikey (Falk), when he fears there is a hit on him. His suspicions are correct, with hitman Kinney (Ned Beatty) on his tail. When Mikey and Nicky are on the run one witnesses the unravelling of their friendship as suspicion, resentment and betrayal surfaces. Cassavetes and Falk revel in each others performances and there is fine support from Ned Beatty, Rose Arrick and Carol Grace.

results.title: Mike and Stefani (50th anniversary reissue)
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and R. Maslyn Williams
results.brief_description: ScreenSound Australia’s 50th anniversary reissue on video of this classic film about post-war refugees, also includes complete segments from the film magazine series ‘Australian Diary’. ‘Mike and Stefani’ chronicles the wartime separation of a young Ukrainian couple, their chance re-union in a refugee camp and their subsequent application to emigrate to Australia. The final scene of the film was structured around an actual interview which was filmed in Germany between a Ukrainian couple and an Australian immigration official. The details of the experiences of the couple, beginning with the pre-war period, were then re-constructed in an episodic, open-ended way characteristic of neo-realist films like ‘Bicycle Thieves’. The film aimed to encourage Anglo-Australians to accept the sudden influx of non-British immigrants in the immediate post-war years. Extensive support materials are available on the ScreenSound Australia website including biographies, primary source documents, textual description and analysis.
